"cryovolcanoes are some of the most intriguing features in the solar system," said Rosaly Lopes , a cassini radar team investigation scientist from nasa's jet propulsion laboratory in pasadena, california. to put them in perspective- if mount vesuvius had been a cryovolcano, its lava would have frozen the residents of pompeii, Rosaly Lopes explained. scientists have suspected cryovolcanoes might inhabit titan, and the cassini mission has collected data on several previous passes of the moon that suggest their existence. imagery of the moon has included a suspect haze hovering
